title: Christina Grimmie's Family Just Released the First Single from Her Posthumous Album
text:
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Christina Grimmie, the talented singer who was shot and killed after her Orlando concert in June 2016, is living on through her music.
On Thursday, the late singer's brother Marcus went on Elvis Duran and The Morning Show to introduce "Invisible." The pop anthem is the first single off Christina's upcoming posthumous album.
"Since about 2015, she's been just grinding it out, writing songs, and has about 50 to 60 songs that are finished vocally, and she'd just been putting in hard work," Marcus said of his sister. "It's unbelievable. No one that I have ever met has worked as hard as she has, and that's for sure. We're very excited to be doing this the way she wanted it done."
Marcus also announced plans to start a foundation in his sister's name. They haven't decided exactly what the foundation will be for, but he has some thoughts.
"As a lot of people know, she was super passionate about breast cancer awareness, animal safety, anti-bullying. There are so many things. So, we are just figuring out what's the best way to allocate the funds."
